overview: Agra, in Uttar Pradesh, is famous for the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort, both UNESCO World Heritage sites. It was the Mughal capital and hosts several other historic monuments, gardens, and tombs. The city is a popular day‑trip destination for visitors to northern India, though it suffers from pollution and aggressive touts.
travelTips: Visit the Taj Mahal early (opening hour) to avoid crowds and heat.
Buy tickets online where possible to skip queues.
Use rickshaws or shared auto‑rickshaws for short trips; negotiate fare beforehand.
Beware of touts and hawkers around monuments; keep valuables secure.
Budget meals are available near the Taj and Agra Fort stations (≈ INR 200‑300 per meal).
Travel by train from Delhi (≈ 2 h) for the cheapest and fastest option.
Carry a water bottle and wear a mask on smoggy days.
